Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup-skyphos; interior glazed black; exterior: glazed black above; below, black-figure decoration consisting of female figure (head in added white with added red fillet in hair remaining) to right; at right, undetermined black figure decoration with white dot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 365-6, no. B487, pl. CLXXXIV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1271) (phase 3)
